data.title: Terminal links don't react to key events performed outside window
data.body:
On mac:

1. cmd+tab to another application
2. Click VS Code window
3. Hover a link in the terminal, it will underline as if cmd is held

data.title: File icon theme not working after update
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (d98a518c5485bd7a47c70f5b3783f70efa5edcd6, 2017-03-29T06:11:14.271Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.0|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.6.2|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.2.1|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|
|theme-glacier|Tyriar|0.0.10|
|theme-sapphire|Tyriar|0.0.5|;

---

Updated to today's insiders and saw this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/24475645/6b4839cc-1485-11e7-80da-11a7d57872da.png)

Error in console:

```
GET file:///C:/Users%C3%9Aimms.vscode-insiders%0Extensionsqinjia.seti-icons-0.1.3%0Fontsseti.woff net::ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND
```

Actual path of woff file:

```
C:\Users\daimms\.vscode-insiders\extensions\qinjia.seti-icons-0.1.3\fonts\seti.woff
```

Reloading the window and restarting VS Code did not fix the issue.

Request json/colorSymbols failed with message: Cannot read property 'schema' of null

I simply opened this file:

```json
{

		"triple-equals": true
	}
}
```

data.title: No cursor change for DND
data.body:
Testing #23329

MacOS

When I press Alt the cursor does not change - I can drag and drop as well as copy.  However the cursor does not change.

Here are my settings (sorry a very ugly theme):
```
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
	//"editor.wrappingColumn": 0,
	"editor.renderIndentGuides": true,
	"editor.renderWhitespace": "all",
	"files.hotExit": "onExitAndWindowClose",
	"files.autoSave": "afterDelay",
	"editor.wordWrap": "on",
	"typescript.referencesCodeLens.enabled": true,
	"debug.inlineValues": true,
	"editor.tabSize": 4,
	"editor.snippetSuggestions": "top",
	"editor.dragAndDrop": true,
	"workbench.iconTheme": "vs-seti",
	"workbench.colorTheme": "Custom Theme",
	"workbench.customColorTheme": {
		"extends": "Default Light+",
		"type": "dark",
		"colors": {
			"activityBarBackground": "#888888",
			"tabsContainerBackground": "#EEEEEE",
			"titleBarActiveBackground": "#EEEEEE",
			"statusBarBackground": "#AAAAAA",
			"statusBarForeground": "#555555",
			"statusBarInfoItemBackground": "#666666",
			"activeTabBackground": "#EEEEEE",
			"activeTabInactiveGroupForeground": "#EEEEEE",
			"inactiveTabBackground": "#AAAAAA"
		} // http://colormind.io/
	}
}
```

cc @roblourens as he was on the books for MacOS testing and may be able to repro.

data.title: Format Document/Selection does not work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.10.1
- OS Version: Mac OSX El Capitan 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a JS file with screwed up syntax (*.js/jsx file)
2. Use the menu option to select either "format document" of "format selection" (with some code selected of course).
3. Expected to format the selection, but the file is not formatted.
4. Notice the error message in the dev console:

```
shell.ts:426 Error processing request. ENOENT: no such file or directory, uv_cwd
Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, uv_cwd
    at Error (native)
    at Object.getCurrentDirectory (/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:3359:36)
    at ProjectService.getScriptInfoForNormalizedPath (/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:71470:98)
    at ProjectService.setHostConfiguration (/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:71477:37)
    at Session.handlers.ts.createMapFromTemplate._a.(anonymous function) (/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:72176:46)
    at /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:73305:88
    at IOSession.Session.executeWithRequestId (/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:73296:28)
    at IOSession.Session.executeCommand (/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:73305:33)
    at IOSession.Session.onMessage (/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:73325:35)
    at Interface.<anonymous> (/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:74477:27)e.onUnexpectedError       
        @ shell.ts:426(anonymous function)
        @ shell.ts:383e.onUnexpectedExternalError
        @ errors.ts:74s
        @ errors.ts:96v
        @ winjs.base.raw.js:1209enter
        @ winjs.base.raw.js:901_run
        @ winjs.base.raw.js:1068_error
        @ winjs.base.raw.js:1041v
        @ winjs.base.raw.js:1209enter
        @ winjs.base.raw.js:901_run
        @ winjs.base.raw.js:1068_error
        @ winjs.base.raw.js:1041(anonymous function)

        @ winjs.base.raw.js:1378v

        @ winjs.base.raw.js:901_run

        @ internal/process/next_tick.js:67_tickCallback
        @ internal/process/next_tick.js:98
```

data.title: Keybindings: canceling popup context menu causes second menu to appear

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
OS: Windows 7
Insiders 3-29

- select key binding line with keyboard
- press Shift-F10
- popup menu appears nearby
- press Escape
- first menu disappears
- second menu appears away from line
- this can be closed by Escape

data.title: Lot of CPU is being consumed when GIT OS Repository is opened in vscode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (a35c7da7b8f324c1e8cc7830173418e392542f6d, 2017-03-28T12:46:15.098Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15164
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.55|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.5|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.11.0|
|resharper9-keybindings|ms-vscode|1.1.0|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Close OS Git repo
2. Open the repo in vscode

You would see log of git status <file> process being forked out for every file in the repo. Machines becomes unusable for an hour. I had to reboot the machine to get it out of that state
I have disabled all git extensions. I believe the default Source Control Git integration is causing this.

data.title: Got "Invalid escape character in string" in settings.json?!
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: win 10 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open your user settings
2. Add 
```
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
    "flowide.pathToFlow": "D:\dev\myproject\node_modules\flow-bin"
}
```
3. Complains about "\d" in "D:\dev\myproject\node_modules\flow-bin" because is not a valid escape character in string. 

I would expect to treat it like a normal string. Is doing more than that.. If I fix to have "D:\\dev\\myproject\\node_modules\\flow-bin", flow is not found...

data.title: SCMResourceDecorations ambiguity
SCM: Tiptool or hover message for SCMResource and SCMResourceGroup

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (d98a518c5485bd7a47c70f5b3783f70efa5edcd6, 2017-03-29T06:11:14.271Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|[vscode-perforce](https://github.com/stef-levesque/vscode-perforce)|slevesque|1.0.0|;


---

Regarding stef-levesque/vscode-perforce#41, it would be nice to have tooltip or hoverMessage for SCMResource and SCMResourceGroup. 

```typescript
/**
 * The tooltip text when you hover over this entry.
 */
tooltip: string | undefined;

/**
 * A message that should be rendered when hovering over the entry.
 */
hoverMessage?: MarkedString | MarkedString[];
```

I would like to add additional information when hovering SCMResourceGroup, like display the whole changelist description. 



cc. @joaomoreno

data.title: Settings options from tasks.json
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.10.2 - OS Version: Windows 10 Hi. I want to know if it's possible to access to settings.json from tasks.json? For example, I have this on my settings.json: "java.home" = "C:\\java", and access it from tasks.json: "command": "${java.home}\\bin\\java".

data.title: To easy to enter multiple keys

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #23287 

I find it really easy - perhaps frustratingly do to enter too many strokes inot the keybinding settings box:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/24467888/285ce9e2-146b-11e7-820d-963f4919d32e.png)

For instance `ctrl+,` can easily end up as `ctrl+,` cord `ctrl+,` .

When attempting to fix this I pressed delete and it made me think, should we add a button to clear the entered data or delete the section of a cord.  To do this I was pressing `delete` but understandably this just bound the key `delete`

data.title: SCM: support icon substitution for SCMResource and SCMResourceGroup UI labels

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (d98a518c5485bd7a47c70f5b3783f70efa5edcd6, 2017-03-29T06:11:14.271Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|[vscode-perforce](https://github.com/stef-levesque/vscode-perforce)|slevesque|1.0.0|;


---
As discussed in stef-levesque/vscode-perforce#41, it would be nice to support [octicon](https://octicons.github.com) icon set for the SCM labels, like vscode.StatusBarItem does. This could help identify additional informations, like:
* `file opened to previous revision` ![octicon-history](https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/octicons/4.4.0/svg/history.svg)
* `file needs to be resolved` ![octicon-alert](https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/octicons/4.4.0/svg/alert.svg)
* `file locked by user` ![octicon-shield](https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/octicons/4.4.0/svg/shield.svg)

cc. @joaomoreno
